title: Queue and Stack Implementation
description: Implemented Stack using Queue and Queue using Stack. Also reinforced fundamentals of stack operations.

title: LeetCode 155 and 20: Min Stack and Valid Parentheses
description: Solved LeetCode Problem 155 'Min Stack' â€” implemented a stack that supports push, pop, top, and retrieving the minimum element in constant time using an auxiliary stack. Also solved Problem 20 'Valid Parentheses'. Gained a deeper understanding of stack operations, handling duplicate minimums, and designing O(1) solutions.

title: Learned Hypothesis Testing in Statistics
description: Studied the core concepts of hypothesis testing, including null and alternate hypotheses, Z-tests, rejection regions, Type I vs. Type II errors, one-tailed vs. two-tailed tests, and its applications in machine learning.

title: Advanced Stack: Expression Conversions & LeetCode Monotonic Stack Problems
description: Practiced various expression conversion algorithms (Infix, Prefix, Postfix). Solved LeetCode problems involving monotonic stacks: #503 'Next Greater Element II' and #735 'Asteroid Collision'.

title: Crypto Investment and Portfolio Management
description: Dedicated time from Sep 29th to Oct 2nd for crypto investment research and managing a friend's portfolio.

title: Completed Probability for AI/ML
description: Completed an intensive 3-day study (Oct 3-5) on the fundamentals of probability required for AI and Machine Learning.

title: Linear Algebra Fundamentals: Scalars to Dot Product
description: Studied foundational concepts in linear algebra, covering scalars, vectors, and the dot product.

title: Advanced Linear Algebra and Dimensionality Reduction
description: Completed a comprehensive 2-day study of linear algebra, covering vectors, matrices, projections, and unit vectors. Delved into data science applications, including data preprocessing (normalization, standardization), covariance matrices, and dimensionality reduction techniques like PCA (with Eigenvalues/Eigenvectors) and t-SNE.

title: Introduction to Calculus
description: Started studying the fundamental basics of calculus.

title: Completed Calculus for Machine Learning
description: Finished an intensive study period from Oct 10th to 18th, completing all calculus fundamentals needed for ML.

title: Started Machine Learning: Days 1-10 of 100 Days of ML
description: Began the '100 Days of Machine Learning' course (CampusX). Covered Days 1-10: What is ML, AI vs ML vs DL, Types of ML (Batch, Online, Instance vs Model), key challenges, applications, the ML Life Cycle, and various data-related job roles.

title: Continued Machine Learning: Days 11-16 of 100 Days of ML
description: Continued the ML course. Learned about Tensors (Day 11), setting up the environment with Anaconda/Jupyter (Day 12), End-to-End project flow (Day 13), framing a problem (Day 14), and handling data from CSV (Day 15) and JSON/SQL (Day 16).

title: Machine Learning: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
description: Continued the '100 Days of ML' course. Covered EDA using Univariate Analysis (Day 20) and Bivariate/Multivariate Analysis (Day 21).

title: Machine Learning: Pandas Profiling & Feature Engineering Intro
description: Learned about automated EDA using Pandas Profiling (Day 22) and started on the fundamentals of Feature Engineering (Day 23).

title: Machine Learning: Feature Scaling
description: Studied different feature scaling techniques, including Standardization (Day 24) and Normalization (MinMax, MaxAbs, Robust Scaling) (Day 25).

title: Machine Learning: Categorical Data Encoding
description: Focused on encoding categorical data. Covered Ordinal Encoding, Label Encoding (Day 26), One-Hot Encoding (Day 27), and using ColumnTransformer for pipelines (Day 28).

title: Machine Learning: Data Transformation
description: Learned about advanced data transformations using FunctionTransformer (Log, Reciprocal, Square Root) (Day 30) and PowerTransformer (Box-Cox, Yeo-Johnson) (Day 31).
